<Perhaps you can,> Empath tells her, <but remember that a criminal as 
notorious as yourself is not as likely to gain amnesty as I am.  YOU 
may the one who gets slagged if some of the less tolerant Maximals 
find you out.  And the Vok are not such an easy target that you can 
hunt them out single-handedly.>

"This way please," she says aloud, leading the pair down the corridor.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Lizzie yawns and seems disinterested.
> 
> Lizzie: Yes, some quarters could be good.
> 
> Her greater Sanguine part then realized that Empath was a telepath.
> {Telepath, eh? Well read my mind. I don't give a slag of the maxies 
or 
> the preds. I'm here for the Vok and I'm going to slag them. Either 
> you're good to yourself and you stay out of my way, or you're not 
and 
> I get forced to slag you. In the meantime, I can help you.}
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Empath::
> > 
> > "Yes, it IS a little unusual to see someone brazenly displaying 
the 
> > Decepticon sigil in a Maximal- and Autobot-inhabited base." 
Empath 
> > agrees.  "But I'm here on a specific agreement with Commander 
> Rodimus 
> > Prime, hence the exception.  Now, let me show the two of you to 
your 
> > quarters."  She beckons them out of the room, and adds a private 
> > message for Sanguine via telepathy: <I know who you are.  Cross 
me 
> > and consider your cover blown.>
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > > ::Amperion::
> > >        He looks at her quizzically glancing at her wing 
> > emblems.  "Bit out of 
> > > place aren't you?"  He then looks confused and glances around 
> > rapidly.  "How 
> > > did I know that?  I'm sorry I'm just a bit disoriented.  My 
name 
> is 
> > Amperion. 
> > >  It is my pleasure to make your acquaintance."  He makes a very 
> > formal and 
> > > crisp bow.
